overview: From 2025-07-20 to 2025-07-27, ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 4 active contributors.

topPRs.title: U13 to U16 template and example task
topPRs.author: Wazabie
topPRs.body:
Adding initial files for the U13 > U16 template:

- This template designed for chains that are still on U12 and want to migrate directly to the latest upgrade level (U16) without executing each phase separately.

- Executes all intermediate upgrade steps:

U12 → U13 → U14 → U15 → U16, in sequence

- Each phase performs the necessary state changes using the appropriate OPCM version

- It currently only validates the final U16 with StandardValidatorV400 and only sets the final absolutePrestate for U16

topContributors.summary: Wazabie: This week, Wazabie focused on a significant upgrade within the `ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops` repository. They merged a substantial PR (#1144) to update templates and example tasks, which involved a major refactor of +3914/-4598 lines. This work modified 18 files, with a notable portion of the changes impacting tests.

scharissis: Focused on improving test coverage in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They opened a pull request to add more sysgo tests for `op-acceptance-tests` (ethereum-optimism/optimism#16817).

AmadiMichael: Focused on configuration refactoring within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They proposed a simplification to the `OpChainConfig` struct by opening a pull request (#16798) to remove the `proxyAdmin` input. This work consisted of changes across 12 files, with a primary focus on configuration and test files.

rickck11: This week, rickck11 contributed a documentation fix to the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository. They merged PR #16753, which corrected line continuation with backslashes. This activity indicates a focus on improving documentation.

gtrepta: Focused on improving system robustness by introducing supervisor fuzzing to the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They opened a significant pull request (#16791) which added over 1800 lines of new code. This work was concentrated on adding new tests and the corresponding code to enable this new testing capability.
Ethnical: Contributed to code quality and collaboration this week by reviewing and commenting on 4 pull requests.
blmalone: Focused on bug fixes this week, committing changes across 10 files (+142/-107 lines). They also contributed to ongoing work by providing feedback on 3 pull requests.

maximevtush: Focused on improving test clarity in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They opened two pull requests to enhance code readability by renaming a test harness (#16782) and a test contract (#16781). This work involved minor refactoring exclusively within test files.

mask-pp: This week, mask-pp's work was focused on the `op-batcher` in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They opened a pull request (#16830) to address an issue with an exposed method. This contribution consisted of a single commit with minor modifications to both code and test files.

mslipper: Focused on planning and coordination within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They created two key issues to track major initiatives: one for the Geth v1.16.1 merge (#16825) and another for the "Min Base Fee" feature (#16807).

yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on the flashblocks feature in the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository, creating issues to plan for load testing on devnets (#16756) and to enable it on a production sequencer (#16759).

pcw109550: This week, their focus was on the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, where they identified a potential enhancement for the `op-sync-tester`. They opened issue #16778 to propose adding support for the sync namespace.
